meanings.definition: To make Russian in character, language, culture, etc.
meanings.sent1: She russifies her cooking by adding traditional Russian spices.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the immigrant community russifies to adapt to the new culture.
meanings.sent3: The school play was russified when the lead actor accidentally spoke in a Russian accent.
meanings.sent4: His love for Russian literature russifies his entire book collection.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush russifies the canvas with vibrant colors and Russian motifs.

meanings.definition: To become Russian in character, language, culture, etc.
meanings.sent1: The foreign exchange student slowly russifies as she learns the language and customs.
meanings.sent2: Living in Moscow for years, he russifies more with each passing day.
meanings.sent3: The stray cat somehow russifies and starts meowing in Russian.
meanings.sent4: As winter sets in, the landscape russifies under a blanket of snow.
meanings.sent5: The old house russifies with age, taking on a charming, Russian-style appearance.
